alert.note: Alert for Iron (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 19 at 1:59PM EDT until further notice by NWS Marquette
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory is extended for the following rivers in Michigan... Paint River at Crystal Falls (Paint) affecting Iron County. ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Michigan... Michigamme River near Crystal Falls (Michigamme) affecting Iron County. Tahquamenon River near Paradise affecting Luce County. .Recent snowmelt and rainfall will lead to elevated river levels. ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Elevated river levels caused by rain and snowmelt continue. * WHERE...Michigamme River near Crystal Falls (Michigamme). * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, 3700 cfs - River begins to flood additional low lying areas along the river bank * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:45 PM CDT Wednesday the stage was 7.9 feet. - Forecast...No forecast is available for this location. - Action stage is 7.0 feet. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. If you are in the advisory area, remain alert to possible flooding or the possibility of the advisory being upgraded to a warning. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/marquette. The next statement will be issued by Thursday afternoon at 100 PM CDT /200 PM EDT/.
